definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

point/dot/drop/speck/o'clock/point (in space or time)/to draw a dot/to check on a list/to choose/to order (food in a restaurant)/to touch briefly/to hint/to light/to ignite/to pour a liquid drop by drop/(old) one fifth of a two-hour watch 更[geng1]/dot stroke in Chinese characters/classifier for items
loud thunder, but only tiny drops of rain (idiom); a lot of talk, but no action/action speaks louder than words/his bite is worse than his bark
pinyin: lei2 sheng1 da4 , yu3 dian3 xiao3

sentences.english: The little rain drop slipt from the umbrella to my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滑下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

sentences.english: Spots of rain had begun to fall.
sentences.chinese: 稀稀拉拉的雨點開始落下來。

sentences.english: The rain drummed loudly on the metal roof.
sentences.chinese: 雨點敲擊金屬屋頂，發出很大的聲響。

sentences.english: But what about bugs no bigger than the raindrops themselves?
sentences.chinese: 但是比雨點還小的小蟲子們，它們的情況怎麼樣呢？

sentences.english: The tears are just like raindrops.
sentences.chinese: 嘩啦啦，小白雲的眼淚像雨點。

sentences.english: Presently raindrops the size of peas stared falling.
sentences.chinese: 不久豆粒大的雨點下了起來。

sentences.english: When it rained, funny sounds came from the splashing raindrop on the butterbur leaf.
sentences.chinese: 下雨了，雨點濺在款冬葉子上發出好聽的聲音。

sentences.english: Collects the golden company to increase holds is the thunderclap big raindrop is small.
sentences.chinese: 匯金公司的增持更是雷聲大雨點小。

sentences.english: The missing becomes long-line, penetrates the thick raindrop, arrives at you.
sentences.chinese: 思念連成長線，穿透厚厚的雨點，來到你身邊。

sentences.english: Rain rattles the roof and thutters at the window.
sentences.chinese: 雨點落在地面上，拍打着窗戶。

sentences.english: He stared at the rain spattering on the glass .
sentences.chinese: 他凝視着雨點濺落在玻璃上。

sentences.english: Bombs rained down on the small village.
sentences.chinese: 炸彈雨點似地落在這個小村莊。

sentences.english: Within a short while larger cloud point and became light rain points.
sentences.chinese: 不一會霧點變大，成了小雨點。

sentences.english: Little rain drops falling from the rib of her umbrella splashed on my glasses.
sentences.chinese: 從她傘骨滑下來的小雨點濺在我眼鏡玻璃上。

sentences.english: The windscreen was spotted with rain.
sentences.chinese: 風擋玻璃上佈滿了雨點。

definition: fine rain/drizzle/poem by Tang poet Li Shangyin 李商隱|李商隐
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
to cut open/to rip/to streak across (lightning, meteor etc)/to pierce (scream, searchlight etc)
to swirl in the air (of thickly falling snowflakes, flower petals etc)/to flutter about
car window/window of vehicle (bus, train etc)
sudden clap of thunder/fig. surprising turn of events
